I am trying to use the new heterogeneous chemistry in Cantera 1.5.  I 
downloaded the latest version of Cantera, Cantera is installed, the 
MATLAB toolboxes are installed, and all the demos work.

However, I can't define my own .cti files in MATLAB.  If I use the 
built-in cti files, it works.  For example, when I enter 

>>gas = importPhase(gri30.cti')

it works, but when I use a file I write, it doesn't work.
I have followed the example in the cti documentation (pg 5).  I enter 
the file 'argon.cti' as the following:

ideal_gas(name = 'argon_gas',
          elements = 'Ar',
          initial_state = state(
                   temperature = 1200.0,
                   pressure = OneAtm
                   )
          )
species(name = 'argon'
        atoms = 'Ar:1'
        thermo = const_cp(t0 = 298.15,
                          h0 = 0.0,
                          cp0 = 2.5*GasConstant,
                          s0 = (154.723, 'J/mol/K')
                          )
       )

However, when I run the file in MATLAB with the command:
>>gas = importPhase('argon.cti')

Cantera throws the error:

??? Error using ==> thermophase/thermophase

Procedure: SpeciesThermoFactory::newSpeciewThermo
Error: Specified species parameterization type (0) does not match any 
known type.

Error in ==> C:\MATLAB6p1\toolbox\cantera\cantera\@Solution\Solution.m
On line 36 ==> t= ThermoPhase(node);

Error in ==> C:\MATLAB6p1\toolbox\cantera\cantera\importPhase.m
On line 5 ==> s = Solution(file);


Does anyone have ideas about how I can fix this?  Has anyone had 
similar problems?

Thanks very much.

Tim Holme
Stanford University
